de.tif.jacob.core.data.impl.index.event
Class IndexEventHandler

java.lang.Object
  de.tif.jacob.core.data.impl.index.event.IndexEventHandler
Direct Known Subclasses:
LuceneEventHandler
public abstract class IndexEventHandler
extends java.lang.Object

Abstract index event handler.

Instances of this class are used to update, (re)build and optimize a search index, which will be used by IndexDataSource implementations to perform queries.

Since:
2.10

Method Detail

containsRecordsOfTableAlias

public abstract boolean containsRecordsOfTableAlias(ITableAlias tableAlias)
Checks whether the index contains records of a given table alias.

Parameters:
tableAlias - the table alias
Returns:
true if the index contains records of the given table alias, otherwise false

getReferencedTableRecord

public abstract IDataTableRecord getReferencedTableRecord(IDataRecord indexRecord)
                                                   throws RecordNotFoundException
Determines the data table record, which is referenced by an index record.

Note: The returned record is the record (at least the one with the same primary key value), which has been originally added to the index by means of IIndexUpdateContext.addToIndex(IDataTableRecord).

Parameters:
indexRecord - the index record, which results from a search on an index data source
Returns:
the referenced record
Throws:
RecordNotFoundException - in case the referenced record can not be retrieved anymore

getMatchingTableFields

public abstract java.util.Set getMatchingTableFields(IDataRecord indexRecord)
                                              throws java.lang.Exception
Determines the table fields of the referenced table record (see getReferencedTableRecord(IDataRecord)), which have been added to an index datasource and are responsible that the given index record has been retrieved.

Parameters:
indexRecord - the index record, which results from a search on an index data source
Returns:
Set of ITableField
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - on any problem in case the matching table fields can not be determined

newIndexUpdateContext

public abstract IIndexUpdateContext newIndexUpdateContext(de.tif.jacob.core.Context context,
                                                          de.tif.jacob.core.data.impl.index.IndexDataSource dataSource)
                                                   throws java.lang.Exception,
                                                          java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
Returns a new index update context which is needed especially when an index is (incrementally) updated and (re)build.

Parameters:
context - the applications current context
dataSource - the index data source
Returns:
a new index update context
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - on any severe problem
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if updating of an index is not supported in the corresponding application. This might be the case for two different applications sharing the same index, i.e. the one application just reading the index (reconfigure flag = none) should throw this exception.
